meanings.definition: The quality or state of being eternal.
meanings.sent1: The eternalness of the stars filled the night sky with endless beauty.
meanings.sent2: Many religions believe in the eternalness of the soul after death.
meanings.sent3: The eternalness of a turtle's life makes them seem like wise old creatures.
meanings.sent4: The eternalness of love can be seen in the bond between a parent and child.
meanings.sent5: The eternalness of the mountains stood as a testament to time itself.

meanings.sent1: In stories, wizards often possess eternalness, living for centuries.
meanings.sent2: The belief in the eternalness of the universe has fascinated scientists for generations.
meanings.sent3: The eternalness of a battery-powered toy can be frustrating for parents.
meanings.sent4: The eternalness of a promise should never be taken lightly.
meanings.sent5: The eternalness of a diamond symbolizes everlasting love in many cultures.

meanings.sent1: Classic literature has a sense of eternalness, appealing to readers across generations.
meanings.sent2: The eternalness of a black dress makes it a staple in every wardrobe.
meanings.sent3: The eternalness of a good joke can bring laughter for years to come.
meanings.sent4: The eternalness of a melody can evoke emotions from listeners of any age.
meanings.sent5: The eternalness of a smile can brighten someone's day in an instant.
